sentences.english: You can't be too careful when you visit the rainforest.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们要去热带雨林我们不能不特别谨严。

sentences.english: Career experts suggest erring on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 职业专家倡议，宁可功于谨严也不要大意。

sentences.english: And I resolved to be cautious how I ventured under those rafters a third time.
sentences.chinese: 我决心在第三次敢于再来到这屋里时可要小心谨严。

sentences.english: Today careful use can easily suggest an Asian influence.
sentences.chinese: 现在，谨严地使用红色很轻易让人想到亚洲的影响。

sentences.english: Imitate the snail in deliberation, the bird in execution.
sentences.chinese: 像蜗牛一样谨严，像鸟儿一样灵敏。

sentences.english: The coward is convinced that he is only being cautious and the miser always thinks he is practicing frugality.
sentences.chinese: 懦夫认为自己谨严，而守财奴也相信自己是节约的。

sentences.english: That most exact and convincing of all sciences, mathematics, is sheerly metaphysical.
sentences.chinese: 科学中最谨严而令人信服的一门。

sentences.english: He combines creative imagination and true scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 和真正的治学谨严学风。

definition: lit. not even one stroke is negligent (idiom)/fig. to write characters (calligraphy) in which every stroke is placed perfectly
amiable (manner)/unassuming/written in plain language/easy to take in
prudent/cautious/to be in charge of ritual ceremonies/to hold an important office
